headline: General Motors deals billion-dollar blow to the EV industry
summary: The U.S. EV market has had a record-setting 2025. But new information from General Motors GM shows just how precarious the industry's perch is. 2025 (through September): over 1 million units, 10.5% market share2024: 1.3 million, 8.1% market share2023: 1.2 million, 7.8% market share2022: 800k 5.8%, ...

headline: GM faces $1.6B EV hit: Analyst discusses 'key point' to remember
summary: General Motors (GM) faces a $1.6 billion hit from changes to its electric vehicle (EV) production plans as automakers react to evolving tax credit policies under the Trump administration. TD Cowen equity analyst Itay Michaeli joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian to discuss what's next for GM in the EV space. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: GM Takes $1.6 Billion Hit for Scaling Back EV Plans
summary: General Motors is taking $1.6 billion in charges for scaling back its electric vehicle production. In a filing Tuesday, the automaker is blaming weaker federal support and weakening demand. GM warns more pain could come as it reassesses its EV strategy. Steve Man, Bloomberg Intelligence Global Autos and Industrials Research Analyst, joined "Bloomberg Open Interest" to break down what this all means for GM's future.

raw.headline: GM Takes $1.6 Billion Hit for Scaling Back EV Plans
raw.summary: General Motors is taking $1.6 billion in charges for scaling back its electric vehicle production. In a filing Tuesday, the automaker is blaming weaker federal support and weakening demand. GM warns more pain could come as it reassesses its EV strategy. Steve Man, Bloomberg Intelligence Global Autos and Industrials Research Analyst, joined "Bloomberg Open Interest" to break down what this all means for GM's future.

headline: GM to take a $1.6 billion hit as tax incentives for EVs are slashed and emission rules ease
summary: General Motors will record a negative impact of $1.6 billion in its next quarter after tax incentives for electric vehicles were slashed by the U.S. and rules governing emissions are relaxed.  The EV tax credit ended last month.  The clean vehicle tax credit was worth $7,500 for new EVs and up to $4,000 for used ones.
